Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior: glazed black with reserved band at rim; exterior: black line at rim and another below junction of lip with bowl; on lip, black-figure decoration consisting of youth (long hair with added red fillet) in short chiton riding horse galloping to right (horse’s head and forelegs lost; red mane, tail, and strokes on ribs and rump); inscription in handle zone.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.40)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 268, no. 9)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 387, no. B551)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 233, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0550) (Phase 1)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 233, no. 2)
